H0.text: Neon is a gas that can cause a glowing splint to burst into flame.

H1.text: Oxygen is the gas that could cause a glowing splint to burst into flame.

H2.text: Nitrogen could cause a glowing splint to burst into flame.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide is the gas that could cause a glowing splint to burst into flame.

A4.text: Concentrated O2 will allow combustion to proceed rapidly and energetically.

A5.text: Many materials including most metals burn faster in oxygen rich environments and ignite at lower temperatures.
